name: Social Feeds for Threads
author: Better Social Feeds

sections.description:
Best WordPress threads plugin that allows admin to display feeds from Threads, an Instagram app on your website. No need to enter any API key to load posts from threads.

You just need the URL of a public profile on Threads and the plugin does the rest for you.

Check out the live Demo here

Use the shortcode [fftmj_feeds] to load threads from the user you set in settings.

Use the shortcode [fftmj_feeds url=”threads_profile_url_here”] to load threads from a different user. Replace “threads_profile_url_here” with your user profile URL.

Example URL of a public profile on Threads – https://www.threads.net/@mosseri

Note: For older users of this plugin, the user ID that you entered should continue to work. The plugin supports both – a user ID and profile URL.

By default the plugin displays only 5 posts per shortcode. You can display more/less posts with the PRO version.

Disclaimer

This is an unofficial plugin and is not linked in any way to the official Threads platform. There is no official API available from threads.net yet. This plugin just fetches the publicly available content.

PRO Version Features

  • Layout Templates – Grid, Slider, and Carousel. (NEW)

  • Change the number of feeds posts from the settings or shortcode. (NEW)

  • Set the max-height of the posts container for list template from the settings.

  • Get the PRO Version Now
sections.installation:
You can install the Plugin in two ways.

WordPress interface installation

  1. Go to plugins in the WordPress admin and click on “Add new”.
  2. In the Search box enter “Social Feeds for Threads” and press Enter.
  3. Click on “Install” to install the plugin.
  4. Activate the plugin.

Manual installation

  1. Download and upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/better-social-feeds directory from the WordPress plugin repository.
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” screen in WordPress admin area.
sections.faq:
How to display feeds from threads?

Install and configure Social Feeds for Threads plugin on your WordPress website and use the shortcode to add threads feeds.

Do I need API?

No, this plugin works without forcing you to have API keys.

What are the shortcodes

Use Shortcode [fftmj_feeds] to load threads from user you set in settings.
Or use [fftmj_feeds url=”threads_profile_url_here”] to load threads from a different user. Replace “threads_profile_url_here” with your user profile URL.

How do I find user profile URL?

Open a threads profile in browser. e.g. – https://www.threads.net/@mosseri
This is the user profile URL. Copy this and enter in the settings or shortcode.
sections.changelog:
0.0.5

  • 2024-04-02
  • Fix – profile url was not working.

0.0.4

  • 2024-03-08
  • Support for entering profile URL instead of user ID.
  • Keep the user ID option working.
  • No need to find the user ID from the Threads profile.

0.0.3

  • 2023-12-22
  • Limit posts count 5 by default.

0.0.2

  • 2023-11-07
  • Updated readme and description.

0.0.1

  • 2023-10-09
  • First version of Feeds for Threads WordPress plugin.

sections.reviews:
well done !

By Ishko on March 5, 2024

This plugin works very well and with the lack of tools to display Threads feeds, I was very happy to find it. Read carefully the instructions to get your Threads numeric user ID and everything works out of the box. If you use custom CSS, the plugin is easy to customize.
Kudos for the devs and thanks for the useful free version, helps to test and may be sufficient if displaying the 5 last posts suits your need.

Better Social Feeds for Threads

By madeleineenvoy on January 25, 2024

Very useful and easy to use plugin

Great Plugin but missing Post Limiter

By janni1101 on December 15, 2023

It's literally the perfect plugin for what I was looking for, but I miss the feature to limit the number of posts displayed.

Great Plugin but it would be perfect with the limit of the number of posts.

By robertogerosa on December 15, 2023

It's the best plugin to show in your website your post of your Threads.

As I write on the title, would be perfect with the limit of the number of posts.
